member.summary: Get the size of the page identified by the property PageNumber.

member.name: P:External.Drawing.XPdfForm.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets the transformation matrix.

member.name: P:External.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page number is one-based, i.e. it is in the range from 1 to PageCount. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:External.Drawing.XPdfForm.PageIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the page index in the external PDF document this object refers to. The page index is zero-based, i.e. it is in the range from 0 to PageCount - 1. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:External.Drawing.XPdfForm.ExternalDocument
member.summary: Gets the underlying document from which pages are imported.

member.summary: This table defines the mapping of character codes to the glyph index values used in the font. It may contain more than one subtable, in order to support more than one character encoding scheme.

member.name: F:External.Fonts.OpenType.CMapTable.symbol
member.summary: Is true for symbol font encoding.

member.name: M:External.Fonts.OpenType.CMapTable.#ctor(External.Fonts.OpenType.FontData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.FontHeaderTable
member.summary: This table gives global information about the font. The bounding box values should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.HorizontalHeaderTable
member.summary: This table contains information for horizontal layout. The values in the minRightSidebearing, minLeftSideBearing and xMaxExtent should be computed using only glyphs that have contours. Glyphs with no contours should be ignored for the purposes of these calculations. All reserved areas must be set to 0.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.HorizontalMetricsTable
member.summary: The type longHorMetric is defined as an array where each element has two parts: the advance width, which is of type USHORT, and the left side bearing, which is of type SHORT. These fields are in font design units.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.VerticalMetricsTable
member.summary: The vertical metrics table allows you to specify the vertical spacing for each glyph in a vertical font. This table consists of either one or two arrays that contain metric information (the advance heights and top sidebearings) for the vertical layout of each of the glyphs in the font.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.MaximumProfileTable
member.summary: This table establishes the memory requirements for this font. Fonts with CFF data must use Version 0.5 of this table, specifying only the numGlyphs field. Fonts with TrueType outlines must use Version 1.0 of this table, where all data is required. Both formats of OpenType require a 'maxp' table because a number of applications call the Windows GetFontData() API on the 'maxp' table to determine the number of glyphs in the font.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.NameTable
member.summary:
The naming table allows multilingual strings to be associated with the OpenTypeTM font file. These strings can represent copyright notices, font names, family names, style names, and so on. To keep this table short, the font manufacturer may wish to make a limited set of entries in some small set of languages; later, the font can be "localized" and the strings translated or added. Other parts of the OpenType font file that require these strings can then refer to them simply by their index number. Clients that need a particular string can look it up by its platform ID, character encoding ID, language ID and name ID. Note that some platforms may require single byte character strings, while others may require double byte strings.
For historical reasons, some applications which install fonts perform version control using Macintosh platform (platform ID 1) strings from the 'name' table. Because of this, we strongly recommend that the 'name' table of all fonts include Macintosh platform strings and that the syntax of the version number (name id 5) follows the guidelines given in this document.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.OS2Table
member.summary: The OS/2 table consists of a set of metrics that are required in OpenType fonts.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.PostScriptTable
member.summary: This table contains additional information needed to use TrueType or OpenTypeTM fonts on PostScript printers.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.ControlValueTable
member.summary: This table contains a list of values that can be referenced by instructions. They can be used, among other things, to control characteristics for different glyphs. The length of the table must be an integral number of FWORD units.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.FontProgram
member.summary: This table is similar to the CVT Program, except that it is only run once, when the font is first used. It is used only for FDEFs and IDEFs. Thus the CVT Program need not contain function definitions. However, the CVT Program may redefine existing FDEFs or IDEFs.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.ControlValueProgram
member.summary: The Control Value Program consists of a set of TrueType instructions that will be executed whenever the font or point size or transformation matrix change and before each glyph is interpreted. Any instruction is legal in the CVT Program but since no glyph is associated with it, instructions intended to move points within a particular glyph outline cannot be used in the CVT Program. The name 'prep' is anachronistic.

member.name: T:External.Fonts.OpenType.GlyphSubstitutionTable
member.summary: This table contains information that describes the glyphs in the font in the TrueType outline format. Information regarding the rasterizer (scaler) refers to the TrueType rasterizer.

member.summary: Specifies the flags of AcroForm fields.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.ReadOnly
member.summary: If set, the user may not change the value of the field. Any associated widget annotations will not interact with the user; that is, they will not respond to mouse clicks or change their appearance in response to mouse motions. This flag is useful for fields whose values are computed or imported from a database.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Required
member.summary: If set, the field must have a value at the time it is exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoExport
member.summary: If set, the field must not be exported by a submit-form action.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Pushbutton
member.summary: If set, the field is a pushbutton that does not retain a permanent value.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Radio
member.summary: If set, the field is a set of radio buttons; if clear, the field is a checkbox. This flag is meaningful only if the Pushbutton flag is clear.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.NoToggleToOff
F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Multiline
member.summary: If set, the field may contain multiple lines of text; if clear, the fields text is restricted to a single line.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Password
member.summary: If set, the field is intended for entering a secure password that should not be echoed visibly to the screen. Characters typed from the keyboard should instead be echoed in some unreadable form, such as asterisks or bullet characters. To protect password confidentiality, viewer applications should never store the value of the text field in the PDF file if this flag is set.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.FileSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field represents the pathname of a file whose contents are to be submitted as the value of the field.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckTextField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotScroll
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the field will not scroll (horizontally for single-line fields, vertically for multiple-line fields) to accommodate more text than will fit within its annotation rectangle. Once the field is full, no further text will be accepted.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Combo
member.summary: If set, the field is a combo box; if clear, the field is a list box.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Edit
F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.Sort
member.summary: If set, the fields option items should be sorted alphabetically. This flag is intended for use by form authoring tools, not by PDF viewer applications; viewers should simply display the options in the order in which they occur in the Opt array.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.MultiSelect
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, more than one of the fields option items may be selected simultaneously; if clear, no more than one item at a time may be selected.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroFieldFlags.DoNotSpellCheckChoiseField
member.summary: (PDF 1.4) If set, the text entered in the field will not be spell-checked. This flag is meaningful only if the Combo and Edit flags are both set.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.TryUnfilter
member.summary: Tries to unfilter the bytes of the stream. If the stream is filtered and PDF component knows the filter algorithm, the stream content is replaced by its unfiltered value and the function returns true. Otherwise the content remains untouched and the function returns false. The function is useful for analyzing existing PDF files.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Zip
member.summary: Compresses the stream with the FlateDecode filter. If a filter is already defined, the function has no effect.

member.summary: Get or sets the bytes of the stream as they are, i.e. if one or more filters exists the bytes are not unfiltered.

member.summary: Gets the value of the stream unfiltered. The stream content is not modified by this operation.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.KeysBase
member.summary: Base class for all dictionary Keys classes.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Length
member.summary: (Required) The number of bytes from the beginning of the line following the keyword stream to the last byte just before the keyword endstream. (There may be an additional EOL marker, preceding endstream, that is not included in the count and is not logically part of the stream data.)

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the stream data found between the keywords stream and endstream, or an array of such names. Multiple filters should be specified in the order in which they are to be applied.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional) A parameter dictionary or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by Filter. If there is only one filter and that filter has parameters, DecodeParms must be set to the filters parameter dictionary unless all the filters parameters have their default values, in which case the DecodeParms entry may be omitted. If there are multiple filters and any of the filters has parameters set to nondefault values, DecodeParms must be an array with one entry for each filter: either the parameter dictionary for that filter, or the null object if that filter has no parameters (or if all of its parameters have their default values). If none of the filters have parameters, or if all their parameters have default values, the DecodeParms entry may be omitted.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.F
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The file containing the stream data. If this entry is present, the bytes between stream and endstream are ignored, the filters are specified by FFilter rather than Filter, and the filter parameters are specified by FDecodeParms rather than DecodeParms. However, the Length entry should still specify the number of those bytes. (Usually, there are no bytes and Length is 0.)

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FFilter
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The name of a filter to be applied in processing the data found in the streams external file, or an array of such names. The same rules apply as for Filter.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.FDecodeParms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A parameter dictionary, or an array of such dictionaries, used by the filters specified by FFilter. The same rules apply as for DecodeParms.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.PdfDictionary.PdfStream.Keys.DL
member.summary: Optional; PDF 1.5) A non-negative integer representing the number of bytes in the decoded (defiltered) stream. It can be used to determine, for example, whether enough disk space is available to write a stream to a file. This value should be considered a hint only; for some stream filters, it may not be possible to determine this value precisely.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.FT
member.summary: (Required for terminal fields; inheritable) The type of field that this dictionary describes: Btn Button Tx Text Ch Choice Sig (PDF 1.3) Signature Note: This entry may be present in a nonterminal field (one whose descendants are themselves fields) in order to provide an inheritable FT value. However, a nonterminal field does not logically have a type of its own; it is merely a container for inheritable attributes that are intended for descendant terminal fields of any type.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Parent
member.summary: (Required if this field is the child of another in the field hierarchy; absent otherwise) The field that is the immediate parent of this one (the field, if any, whose Kids array includes this field). A field can have at most one parent; that is, it can be included in the Kids array of at most one other field.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Kids
member.summary: (Optional) An array of indirect references to the immediate children of this field.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.T
member.summary: (Optional) The partial field name.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TU
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An alternate field name, to be used in place of the actual field name wherever the field must be identified in the user interface (such as in error or status messages referring to the field). This text is also useful when extracting the documents contents in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.TM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The mapping name to be used when exporting interactive form field data from the document.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Ff
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A set of flags specifying various characteristics of the field. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.V
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The fields value, whose format varies depending on the field type; see the descriptions of individual field types for further information.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DV
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) The default value to which the field reverts when a reset-form action is executed. The format of this value is the same as that of V.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An additional-actions dictionary defining the fields behavior in response to various trigger events. This entry has exactly the same meaning as the AA entry in an annotation dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) A resource dictionary containing default resources (such as fonts, patterns, or color spaces) to be used by the appearance stream. At a minimum, this dictionary must contain a Font entry specifying the resource name and font dictionary of the default font for displaying the fields text.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The default appearance string, containing a sequence of valid page-content graphics or text state operators defining such properties as the fields text size and color.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroField.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) A code specifying the form of quadding (justification) to be used in displaying the text: 0 Left-justified 1 Centered 2 Right-justified Default value: 0 (left-justified).

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Fields
member.summary: (Required) An array of references to the documents root fields (those with no ancestors in the field hierarchy).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.NeedAppearances
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to construct appearance streams and appearance dictionaries for all widget annotations in the document. Default value: false.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.SigFlags
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A set of flags specifying various document-level characteristics related to signature fields. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.CO
member.summary: (Required if any fields in the document have additional-actions dictionaries containing a C entry; PDF 1.3) An array of indirect references to field dictionaries with calculation actions, defining the calculation order in which their values will be recalculated when the value of any field changes.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DR
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DR attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.DA
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the DA attribute of variable text fields.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfAcroForm.Keys.Q
member.summary: (Optional) A document-wide default value for the Q attribute of variable text fields.

member.summary: Gets the index of the specified string in the /Opt array or -1, if no such string exists.

member.summary: Gets the value from the index in the /Opt array.

member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.Opt
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) An array of options to be presented to the user. Each element of the array is either a text string representing one of the available options or a two-element array consisting of a text string together with a default appearance string for constructing the items appearance dynamically at viewing time.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.TI
member.summary: (Optional; inheritable) For scrollable list boxes, the top index (the index in the Opt array of the first option visible in the list).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfChoiceField.Keys.I
member.summary: (Sometimes required, otherwise optional; inheritable; PDF 1.4) For choice fields that allow multiple selection (MultiSelect flag set), an array of integers, sorted in ascending order, representing the zero-based indices in the Opt array of the currently selected option items. This entry is required when two or more elements in the Opt array have different names but the same export value, or when the value of the choice field is an array; in other cases, it is permitted but not required. If the items identified by this entry differ from those in the V entry of the field dictionary (see below), the V entry takes precedence.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary. The description comes from PDF 1.4 Reference.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Sig for a signature dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Filter
member.summary: (Required; inheritable) The name of the signature handler to be used for authenticating the fields contents, such as Adobe.PPKLite, Entrust.PPKEF, CICI.SignIt, or VeriSign.PPKVS.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.SubFilter
member.summary: (Optional) The name of a specific submethod of the specified handler.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.ByteRange
member.summary: (Required) An array of pairs of integers (starting byte offset, length in bytes) describing the exact byte range for the digest calculation. Multiple discontinuous byte ranges may be used to describe a digest that does not include the signature token itself.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Contents
member.summary: (Required) The encrypted signature token.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Optional) The name of the person or authority signing the document.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.M
member.summary: (Optional) The time of signing. Depending on the signature handler, this may be a normal unverified computer time or a time generated in a verifiable way from a secure time server.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Location
member.summary: (Optional) The CPU host name or physical location of the signing.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Reason
member.summary: (Optional) The reason for the signing, such as (I agree).

member.name: P:External.Pdf.AcroForms.PdfSignatureField.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Catalog for the catalog dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Version
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The version of the PDF specification to which the document conforms (for example, 1.4) if later than the version specified in the files header. If the header specifies a later version, or if this entry is absent, the document conforms to the version specified in the header. This entry enables a PDF producer application to update the version using an incremental update.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Pages
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) The page tree node that is the root of the documents page tree.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLabels
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A number tree defining the page labeling for the document. The keys in this tree are page indices; the corresponding values are page label dictionaries. Each page index denotes the first page in a labeling range to which the specified page label dictionary applies. The tree must include a value for pageindex 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Names
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The documents name dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Dests
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) A dictionary of names and corresponding destinations.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.ViewerPreferences
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A viewer preferences dictionary specifying the way the document is to be displayed on the screen. If this entry is absent, applications should use their own current user preference settings.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageLayout
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying the page layout to be used when the document is opened: SinglePage - Display one page at a time. OneColumn - Display the pages in one column. TwoColumnLeft - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the left. TwoColumnRight - Display the pages in two columns, with oddnumbered pages on the right. TwoPageLeft - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the left TwoPageRight - (PDF 1.5) Display the pages two at a time, with odd-numbered pages on the right.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PageMode
member.summary: (Optional) A name object specifying how the document should be displayed when opened: UseNone - Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible. UseOutlines - Document outline visible. UseThumbs - Thumbnail images visible. FullScreen - Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, windowcontrols, or any other window visible. UseOC - (PDF 1.5) Optional content group panel visible. UseAttachments (PDF 1.6) Attachments panel visible. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Outlines
member.summary: (Optional; must be an indirect reference) The outline dictionary that is the root of the documents outline hierarchy.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Threads
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1; must be an indirect reference) An array of thread dictionaries representing the documents article threads.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OpenAction
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A value specifying a destination to be displayed or an action to be performed when the document is opened. The value is either an array defining a destination or an action dictionary representing an action. If this entry is absent, the document should be opened to the top of the first page at the default magnification factor.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.AA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) An additional-actions dictionary defining the actions to be taken in response to various trigger events affecting the document as a whole.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.URI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A URI dictionary containing document-level information for URI (uniform resource identifier) actions.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.AcroForm
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) The documents interactive form (AcroForm) dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4; must be an indirect reference) A metadata stream containing metadata for the document.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.StructTreeRoot
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The documents structure tree root dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.MarkInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A mark information dictionary containing information about the documents usage of Tagged PDF conventions.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Lang
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A language identifier specifying the natural language for all text in the document except where overridden by language specifications for structure elements or marked content. If this entry is absent, the language is considered unknown.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.SpiderInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A Web Capture information dictionary containing state information used by the Acrobat Web Capture (AcroSpider) plugin extension.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OutputIntents
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) An array of output intent dictionaries describing the color characteristics of output devices on which the document might be rendered.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.PieceInfo
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A page-piece dictionary associated with the document.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.OCProperties
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; required if a document contains optional content) The documents optional content properties dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Perms
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A permissions dictionary that specifies user access permissions for the document.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCatalog.Keys.Legal
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) A dictionary containing attestations regarding the content of a PDF document, as it relates to the legality of digital signatures.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required except for the standard 14 fonts; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the fonts metrics other than its glyph widths. Note: For the standard 14 fonts, the entries FirstChar, LastChar, Widths, and FontDescriptor must either all be present or all be absent. member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be Font for a CIDFont dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of CIDFont; CIDFontType0 or CIDFontType2.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.BaseFont
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the CIDFont. For Type 0 CIDFonts, this is usually the value of the CIDFontName entry in the CIDFont program. For Type 2 CIDFonts, it is derived the same way as for a simple TrueType font; In either case, the name can have a subset prefix if appropriate.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDSystemInfo
member.summary: (Required) A dictionary containing entries that define the character collection of the CIDFont.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.FontDescriptor
member.summary: (Required; must be an indirect reference) A font descriptor describing the CIDFonts default metrics other than its glyph widths.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW
member.summary: (Optional) The default width for glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: 1000.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W
member.summary: (Optional) A description of the widths for the glyphs in the CIDFont. The arrays elements have a variable format that can specify individual widths for consecutive CIDs or one width for a range of CIDs. Default value: none (the DW value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.DW2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) An array of two numbers specifying the default metrics for vertical writing. Default value: [880 1000].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.W2
member.summary: (Optional; applies only to CIDFonts used for vertical writing) A description of the metrics for vertical writing for the glyphs in the CIDFont. Default value: none (the DW2 value is used for all glyphs).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfCIDFont.Keys.CIDToGIDMap
member.summary: (Optional; Type 2 CIDFonts only) A specification of the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices. If the value is a stream, the bytes in the stream contain the mapping from CIDs to glyph indices: the glyph index for a particular CID value c is a 2-byte value stored in bytes 2 c and 2 c + 1, where the first byte is the high-order byte. If the value of CIDToGIDMap is a name, it must be Identity, indicating that the mapping between CIDs and glyph indices is the identity mapping. Default value: Identity. This entry may appear only in a Type 2 CIDFont whose associated True-Type font program is embedded in the PDF file.

member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be ExtGState for a graphics state parameter dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LW
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line width (see Line Width on page 185).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line cap style.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.LJ
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line join style.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.ML
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The miter limit.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.D
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The line dash pattern, expressed as an array of the form [dashArray dashPhase], where dashArray is itself an array and dashPhase is an integer.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.RI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The name of the rendering intent.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OP
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint. In PDF 1.2 and earlier, there is a single overprint parameter that applies to all painting operations. Beginning with PDF 1.3, there are two separate overprint parameters: one for stroking and one for all other painting operations. Specifying an OP entry sets both parameters unless there is also an op entry in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, in which case the OP entry sets only the overprint parameter for stroking.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.op
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) A flag specifying whether to apply overprint for painting operations other than stroking. If this entry is absent, the OP entry, if any, sets this parameter.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.OPM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) The overprint mode.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.Font
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of the form [font size], where font is an indirect reference to a font dictionary and size is a number expressed in text space units. These two objects correspond to the operands of the Tf operator; however, the first operand is an indirect object reference instead of a resource name.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG
member.summary: (Optional) The black-generation function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [0.0 1.0].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BG2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as BG except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the black-generation function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both BG and BG2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, BG2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR
member.summary: (Optional) The undercolor-removal function, which maps the interval [0.0 1.0] to the interval [-1.0 1.0].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.UCR2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) Same as UCR except that the value may also be the name Default, denoting the undercolor-removal function that was in effect at the start of the page. If both UCR and UCR2 are present in the same graphics state parameter dictionary, UCR2 takes precedence.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SA
member.summary: (Optional) A flag specifying whether to apply automatic stroke adjustment.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.BM
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current blend mode to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current soft mask, specifying the mask shape or mask opacity values to be used in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.CA
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The current stroking alpha constant, specifying the constant shape or constant opacity value to be used for stroking operations in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.ca
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) Same as CA, but for nonstroking operations.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.AIS
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The alpha source flag (alpha is shape), specifying whether the current soft mask and alpha constant are to be interpreted as shape values (true) or opacity values (false).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.TK
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) The text knockout flag, which determines the behavior of overlapping glyphs within a text object in the transparent imaging model.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfExtGState.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags
member.summary: The PDF font descriptor flags.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.FixedPitch
member.summary: All glyphs have the same width (as opposed to proportional or variable-pitch fonts, which have different widths).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Serif
member.summary: Glyphs have serifs, which are short strokes drawn at an angle on the top and bottom of glyph stems. (Sans serif fonts do not have serifs.)

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Symbolic
member.summary: Font contains glyphs outside the Adobe standard Latin character set. This flag and the Nonsymbolic flag cannot both be set or both be clear.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Script
member.summary: Glyphs resemble cursive handwriting.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Nonsymbolic
member.summary: Font uses the Adobe standard Latin character set or a subset of it.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.Italic
member.summary: Glyphs have dominant vertical strokes that are slanted.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.AllCap
member.summary: Font contains no lowercase letters; typically used for display purposes, such as for titles or headlines.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.SmallCap
member.summary: Font contains both uppercase and lowercase letters. The uppercase letters are similar to those in the regular version of the same typeface family. The glyphs for the lowercase letters have the same shapes as the corresponding uppercase letters, but they are sized and their proportions adjusted so that they have the same size and stroke weight as lowercase glyphs in the same typeface family.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptorFlags.ForceBold
member.summary: Determines whether bold glyphs are painted with extra pixels even at very small text sizes.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor
member.summary: A PDF font descriptor specifies metrics and other attributes of a simple font, as distinct from the metrics of individual glyphs.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is symbol font.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Required) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; must be FontDescriptor for a font descriptor.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontName
member.summary: (Required) The PostScript name of the font. This name should be the same as the value of BaseFont in the font or CIDFont dictionary that refers to this font descriptor.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFamily
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) A string specifying the preferred font family name. For example, for the font Times Bold Italic, the FontFamily is Times.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontStretch
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The font stretch value. It must be one of the following names (ordered from narrowest to widest): UltraCondensed, ExtraCondensed, Condensed, SemiCondensed, Normal, SemiExpanded, Expanded, ExtraExpanded or UltraExpanded. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, Condensed in one font may appear most similar to Normal in another.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontWeight
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5; strongly recommended for Type 3 fonts in Tagged PDF documents) The weight (thickness) component of the fully-qualified font name or font specifier. The possible values are 100, 200, 300, 400, 500, 600, 700, 800, or 900, where each number indicates a weight that is at least as dark as its predecessor. A value of 400 indicates a normal weight; 700 indicates bold. Note: The specific interpretation of these values varies from font to font. For example, 300 in one font may appear most similar to 500 in another.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Flags
member.summary: (Required) A collection of flags defining various characteristics of the font.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontBBox
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) A rectangle (see Section 3.8.4, Rectangles), expressed in the glyph coordinate system, specifying the font bounding box. This is the smallest rectangle enclosing the shape that would result if all of the glyphs of the font were placed with their origins coincident and then filled.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.ItalicAngle
member.summary: (Required) The angle, expressed in degrees counterclockwise from the vertical, of the dominant vertical strokes of the font. (For example, the 9-oclock position is 90 degrees, and the 3-oclock position is 90 degrees.) The value is negative for fonts that slope to the right, as almost all italic fonts do.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Ascent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum height above the baseline reached by glyphs in this font, excluding the height of glyphs for accented characters.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Descent
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The maximum depth below the baseline reached by glyphs in this font. The value is a negative number.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.Leading
member.summary: (Optional) The spacing between baselines of consecutive lines of text. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CapHeight
member.summary: (Required for fonts that have Latin characters, except for Type 3 fonts) The vertical coordinate of the top of flat capital letters, measured from the baseline.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.XHeight
member.summary: (Optional) The fonts x height: the vertical coordinate of the top of flat nonascending lowercase letters (like the letter x), measured from the baseline, in fonts that have Latin characters. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemV
member.summary: (Required, except for Type 3 fonts) The thickness, measured horizontally, of the dominant vertical stems of glyphs in the font.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.StemH
member.summary: (Optional) The thickness, measured vertically, of the dominant horizontal stems of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.AvgWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The average width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MaxWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The maximum width of glyphs in the font. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.MissingWidth
member.summary: (Optional) The width to use for character codes whose widths are not specified in a font dictionarys Widths array. This has a predictable effect only if all such codes map to glyphs whose actual widths are the same as the value of the MissingWidth entry. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile
member.summary: (Optional) A stream containing a Type 1 font program.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile2
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) A stream containing a TrueType font program.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.FontFile3
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) A stream containing a font program whose format is specified by the Subtype entry in the stream dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFontDescriptor.Keys.CharSet
member.summary: (Optional; meaningful only in Type 1 fonts; PDF 1.1) A string listing the character names defined in a font subset. The names in this string must be in PDF syntaxthat is, each name preceded by a slash (/). The names can appear in any order. The name .notdef should be omitted; it is assumed to exist in the font subset. If this entry is absent, the only indication of a font subset is the subset tag in the FontName entry.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.BBox
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the form coordinate system, giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the form XObjects bounding box. These boundaries are used to clip the form XObject and to determine its size for caching.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Matrix
member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the form matrix, which maps form space into user space. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Resources
member.summary: (Optional but strongly recommended; PDF 1.2) A dictionary specifying any resources (such as fonts and images) required by the form XObject.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfFormXObject.Keys.Group
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A group attributes dictionary indicating that the contents of the form XObject are to be treated as a group and specifying the attributes of that group (see Section 4.9.2, Group XObjects). Note: If a Ref entry (see below) is present, the group attributes also apply to the external page imported by that entry, which allows such an imported page to be treated as a group without further modification.

member.summary: Gets the underlying XImage object.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be XObject for an image XObject.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Subtype
member.summary: (Required) The type of XObject that this dictionary describes; must be Image for an image XObject.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Width
member.summary: (Required) The width of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Height
member.summary: (Required) The height of the image, in samples.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required for images, except those that use the JPXDecode filter; not allowed for image masks) The color space in which image samples are specified; it can be any type of color space except Pattern. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional: If ColorSpace is present, any color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are ignored. If ColorSpace is absent, the color space specifications in the JPEG2000 data are used. The Decode array is also ignored unless ImageMask is true.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.BitsPerComponent
member.summary: (Required except for image masks and images that use the JPXDecode filter) The number of bits used to represent each color component. Only a single value may be specified; the number of bits is the same for all color components. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and (in PDF 1.5) 16. If ImageMask is true, this entry is optional, and if specified, its value must be 1. If the image stream uses a filter, the value of BitsPerComponent must be consistent with the size of the data samples that the filter delivers. In particular, a CCITTFaxDecode or JBIG2Decode filter always delivers 1-bit samples, a RunLengthDecode or DCTDecode filter delivers 8-bit samples, and an LZWDecode or FlateDecode filter delivers samples of a specified size if a predictor function is used. If the image stream uses the JPXDecode filter, this entry is optional and ignored if present. The bit depth is determined in the process of decoding the JPEG2000 image.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Intent
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.1) The name of a color rendering intent to be used in rendering the image. Default value: the current rendering intent in the graphics state.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ImageMask
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether the image is to be treated as an image mask. If this flag is true, the value of BitsPerComponent must be 1 and Mask and ColorSpace should not be specified; unmasked areas are painted using the current nonstroking color. Default value: false.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Mask
member.summary: (Optional except for image masks; not allowed for image masks; PDF 1.3) An image XObject defining an image mask to be applied to this image, or an array specifying a range of colors to be applied to it as a color key mask. If ImageMask is true, this entry must not be present.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Decode
member.summary: (Optional) An array of numbers describing how to map image samples into the range of values appropriate for the images color space. If ImageMask is true, the array must be either [0 1] or [1 0]; otherwise, its length must be twice the number of color components required by ColorSpace. If the image uses the JPXDecode filter and ImageMask is false, Decode is ignored. Default value: see Decode Arrays.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Interpolate
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether image interpolation is to be performed. Default value: false.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Alternates
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3) An array of alternate image dictionaries for this image. The order of elements within the array has no significance. This entry may not be present in an image XObject that is itself an alternate image.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMask
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A subsidiary image XObject defining a soft-mask image to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity values in the transparent imaging model. The alpha source parameter in the graphics state determines whether the mask values are interpreted as shape or opacity. If present, this entry overrides the current soft mask in the graphics state, as well as the images Mask entry, if any. (However, the other transparency related graphics state parameters blend mode and alpha constant remain in effect.) If SMask is absent, the image has no associated soft mask (although the current soft mask in the graphics state may still apply).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.SMaskInData
member.summary: (Optional for images that use the JPXDecode filter, meaningless otherwise; PDF 1.5) A code specifying how soft-mask information encoded with image samples should be used: 0 If present, encoded soft-mask image information should be ignored. 1 The images data stream includes encoded soft-mask values. An application can create a soft-mask image from the information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency imaging model. 2 The images data stream includes color channels that have been preblended with a background; the image data also includes an opacity channel. An application can create a soft-mask image with a Matte entry from the opacity channel information to be used as a source of mask shape or mask opacity in the transparency model. If this entry has a nonzero value, SMask should not be specified. Default value: 0.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Name
member.summary: (Required in PDF 1.0; optional otherwise) The name by which this image XObject is referenced in the XObject subdictionary of the current resource dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.StructParent
member.summary: (Required if the image is a structural content item; PDF 1.3) The integer key of the images entry in the structural parent tree.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.ID
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.3; indirect reference preferred) The digital identifier of the images parent Web Capture content set.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OPI
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.2) An OPI version dictionary for the image. If ImageMask is true, this entry is ignored.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.Metadata
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.4) A metadata stream containing metadata for the image.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfImage.Keys.OC
member.summary: (Optional; PDF 1.5) An optional content group or optional content membership dictionary, specifying the optional content properties for this image XObject. Before the image is processed, its visibility is determined based on this entry. If it is determined to be invisible, the entire image is skipped, as if there were no Do operator to invoke it.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfInternals.GetClosure(External.Pdf.PdfObject)
member.summary: Returns an array containing the specified object as first element follows by its transitive closure. The closure of an object are all objects that can be reached by indirect references. The transitive closure is the result of applying the calculation of the closure to a closure as long as no new objects came along. This is e.g. useful for getting all objects belonging to the resources of a page.

member.summary: Returns an array containing the specified object as first element follows by its transitive closure limited by the specified number of iterations.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading
member.summary: Represents a shading dictionary.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.SetupFromBrush(External.Drawing.XLinearGradientBrush)
member.summary: Setups the shading from the specified brush.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.ShadingType
member.summary: (Required) The shading type: 1 Function-based shading 2 Axial shading 3 Radial shading 4 Free-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh 5 Lattice-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh 6 Coons patch mesh 7 Tensor-product patch mesh

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.ColorSpace
member.summary: (Required) The color space in which color values are expressed. This may be any device, CIE-based, or special color space except a Pattern space.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Background
member.summary: (Optional) An array of color components appropriate to the color space, specifying a single background color value. If present, this color is used, before any painting operation involving the shading, to fill those portions of the area to be painted that lie outside the bounds of the shading object. In the opaque imaging model, the effect is as if the painting operation were performed twice: first with the background color and then with the shading.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.BBox
member.summary: (Optional) An array of four numbers giving the left, bottom, right, and top coordinates, respectively, of the shadings bounding box. The coordinates are interpreted in the shadings target coordinate space. If present, this bounding box is applied as a temporary clipping boundary when the shading is painted, in addition to the current clipping path and any other clipping boundaries in effect at that time.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.AntiAlias
member.summary: (Optional) A flag indicating whether to filter the shading function to prevent aliasing artifacts. The shading operators sample shading functions at a rate determined by the resolution of the output device. Aliasing can occur if the function is not smooththat is, if it has a high spatial frequency relative to the sampling rate. Anti-aliasing can be computationally expensive and is usually unnecessary, since most shading functions are smooth enough or are sampled at a high enough frequency to avoid aliasing effects. Anti-aliasing may not be implemented on some output devices, in which case this flag is ignored. Default value: false.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Coords
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers [x0 y0 x1 y1] specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the axis, expressed in the shadings target coordinate space.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Domain
member.summary: (Optional) An array of two numbers [t0 t1] specifying the limiting values of a parametric variable t. The variable is considered to vary linearly between these two values as the color gradient varies between the starting and ending points of the axis. The variable t becomes the input argument to the color function(s). Default value: [0.0 1.0].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Function
member.summary: (Required) A 1-in, n-out function or an array of n 1-in, 1-out functions (where n is the number of color components in the shading dictionarys color space). The function(s) are called with values of the parametric variable t in the domain defined by the Domain entry. Each functions domain must be a superset of that of the shading dictionary. If the value returned by the function for a given color component is out of range, it is adjusted to the nearest valid value.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Extend
member.summary: (Optional) An array of two boolean values specifying whether to extend the shading beyond the starting and ending points of the axis, respectively. Default value: [false false].

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShading.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShadingPattern.Keys.Shading
member.summary: (Required) A shading object (see below) defining the shading patterns gradient fill.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShadingPattern.Keys.Matrix
member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the pattern matrix. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfShadingPattern.Keys.ExtGState
member.summary: (Optional) A graphics state parameter dictionary containing graphics state parameters to be put into effect temporarily while the shading pattern is painted. Any parameters that are not so specified are inherited from the graphics state that was in effect at the beginning of the content stream in which the pattern is defined as a resource.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask
member.summary: Represents a PDF soft mask.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.#ctor(External.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The document that owns the object.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys
member.summary: Predefined keys of this dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Mask for a soft-mask dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys.S
member.summary: (Required) A subtype specifying the method to be used in deriving the mask values from the transparency group specified by the G entry: Alpha: Use the groups computed alpha, disregarding its color. Luminosity: Convert the groups computed color to a single-component luminosity value.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys.G
member.summary: (Required) A transparency group XObject to be used as the source of alpha or color values for deriving the mask. If the subtype S is Luminosity, the group attributes dictionary must contain a CS entry defining the color space in which the compositing computation is to be performed.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys.BC
member.summary: (Optional) An array of component values specifying the color to be used as the backdrop against which to composite the transparency group XObject G. This entry is consulted only if the subtype S is Luminosity. The array consists of n numbers, where n is the number of components in the color space specified by the CS entry in the group attributes dictionary. Default value: the color spaces initial value, representing black.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfSoftMask.Keys.TR
member.summary: (Optional) A function object specifying the transfer function to be used in deriving the mask values. The function accepts one input, the computed group alpha or luminosity (depending on the value of the subtype S), and returns one output, the resulting mask value. Both the input and output must be in the range 0.0 to 1.0; if the computed output falls outside this range, it is forced to the nearest valid value. The name Identity may be specified in place of a function object to designate the identity function. Default value: Identity.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern
member.summary: Represents a tiling pattern dictionary.

member.name: M:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.#ctor(External.Pdf.PdfDocument)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta of this dictionary type.

member.name: T:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys
member.summary: Common keys for all streams.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.Type
member.summary: (Optional) The type of PDF object that this dictionary describes; if present, must be Pattern for a pattern dictionary.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.PatternType
member.summary: (Required) A code identifying the type of pattern that this dictionary describes; must be 1 for a tiling pattern.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.PaintType
member.summary: (Required) A code that determines how the color of the pattern cell is to be specified: 1: Colored tiling pattern. The patterns content stream specifies the colors used to paint the pattern cell. When the content stream begins execution, the current color is the one that was initially in effect in the patterns parent content stream. 2: Uncolored tiling pattern. The patterns content stream does not specify any color information. Instead, the entire pattern cell is painted with a separately specified color each time the pattern is used. Essentially, the content stream describes a stencil through which the current color is to be poured. The content stream must not invoke operators that specify colors or other color-related parameters in the graphics state; otherwise, an error occurs. The content stream may paint an image mask, however, since it does not specify any color information.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.TilingType
member.summary: (Required) A code that controls adjustments to the spacing of tiles relative to the device pixel grid: 1: Constant spacing. Pattern cells are spaced consistentlythat is, by a multiple of a device pixel. To achieve this, the application may need to distort the pattern cell slightly by making small adjustments to XStep, YStep, and the transformation matrix. The amount of distortion does not exceed 1 device pixel. 2: No distortion. The pattern cell is not distorted, but the spacing between pattern cells may vary by as much as 1 device pixel, both horizontally and vertically, when the pattern is painted. This achieves the spacing requested by XStep and YStep on average but not necessarily for each individual pattern cell. 3: Constant spacing and faster tiling. Pattern cells are spaced consistently as in tiling type 1 but with additional distortion permitted to enable a more efficient implementation.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.BBox
member.summary: (Required) An array of four numbers in the pattern coordinate system giving the coordinates of the left, bottom, right, and top edges, respectively, of the pattern cells bounding box. These boundaries are used to clip the pattern cell.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.XStep
member.summary: (Required) The desired horizontal spacing between pattern cells, measured in the pattern coordinate system.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.YStep
member.summary: (Required) The desired vertical spacing between pattern cells, measured in the pattern coordinate system. Note that XStep and YStep may differ from the dimensions of the pattern cell implied by the BBox entry. This allows tiling with irregularly shaped figures. XStep and YStep may be either positive or negative but not zero.

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.Resources
member.summary: (Required) A resource dictionary containing all of the named resources required by the patterns content stream (see Section 3.7.2, Resource Dictionaries).

member.name: F:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.Matrix
member.summary: (Optional) An array of six numbers specifying the pattern matrix. Default value: the identity matrix [1 0 0 1 0 0].

member.name: P:External.Pdf.Advanced.PdfTilingPattern.Keys.Meta
member.summary: Gets the KeysMeta for these keys.

Equivalently, this value is 1 greater than the highest object number used in the file. Note: Any object in a cross-reference section whose number is greater than this value is ignored and considered missing.

member.summary: (Present only if the file has more than one cross-reference section; must not be an indirect reference) The byte offset from the beginning of the file to the beginning of the previous cross-reference section.

member.summary: (Optional, but strongly recommended; PDF 1.1) An array of two strings constituting a file identifier for the file. Although this entry is optional, its absence might prevent the file from functioning in some workflows that depend on files being uniquely identified.
